conbody.p: Three main taxonomies are created for investigating a narrative text:

These taxonomies are described within two encoding description sections: <encodingDesc><classDecl> <taxonomy xml:id="primaryData"> <!-- Primary Data --> </taxonomy> <taxonomy xml:id="objectiveVar"> <!-- Objective variables --> </taxonomy> <taxonomy xml:id="subjectiveVar"> <!-- Subjective variables --> </taxonomy> </classDecl></encodingDesc>

In anticipation or the future development of an (OWL) ontology of power relationships using linked open data standards, I have equated existent OWL or RDF classes with certain TEI-XML attributes (these have been specified where relevant):
Onyx Ontology Specification for subjective data
OntoMedia ontology for primary data and objective variables

My choice of using the OntoMedia ontology is relevant because we share the same primary goal, althought final purpose is different since mine is for anthropological purpose: to allow people to explore and analyse narratives
